attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We pay over 50p per litre of fuel to the government yet our road network is underfunded to the tune of £1bn a year, or 50% of their required budget. On top of this councils are spending £50m on compensation claims for damaged vehicles and personal injuries. Yet, on average, it takes 61 years for a given road to be resurfaced in England. We call on the government to spend the money we pay to use the roads on repairing them to a condition which is satisfactory and safe to all road users. From fuel duty alone the government receives over £26bn per year, and they receive another £5bn from vehicle exercise duty. Is it too much to ask that an adequate amount of this is spent repairing our roads?
